name: Chicken Vindaloo
history: Vindaloo is a Goan dish with Portuguese origins, known for its hot and tangy flavor profile. It has evolved in India with the addition of spices and local ingredients like vinegar and chili.
description: Chicken Vindaloo is a fiery and tangy curry that combines tender chicken pieces with a spicy and sour sauce made from vinegar, garlic, and a variety of Indian spices. It's known for its bold flavors and heat.

instructions.title: Marinate the Chicken
instructions.description: Mix chicken pieces with vinegar, ginger-garlic paste, turmeric powder, red chili powder, cumin powder, and salt. Let it marinate for at least 1 hour.

instructions.title: Cook the Onions
instructions.description: Heat oil in a pan. Add onions and cook until they turn golden brown.

instructions.title: Add Chicken and Spices
instructions.description: Add the marinated chicken to the pan and cook until it starts to brown.

instructions.title: Add Tomato Puree and Simmer
instructions.description: Add tomato puree, coriander powder, and sugar. Mix well. Add water as needed and bring to a boil. Reduce heat and simmer until the chicken is tender.

instructions.title: Finish with Garam Masala
instructions.description: Add garam masala and cook for a few more minutes.

instructions.title: Garnish and Serve
instructions.description: Garnish with chopped cilantro. Serve hot with rice or Indian bread.

tips: Let the chicken marinate for as long as possible for better flavor absorption.
Adjust the amount of red chili powder to suit your spice preference.
variations: Add potatoes or bell peppers for additional texture.
Use coconut vinegar for a different flavor profile.

storage.shelfLife: Can be refrigerated for up to 3 days.
storage.instructions: Store in an airtight container in the refrigerator.

reheatingInstructions: Reheat on the stove or in a microwave until hot.
presentationTips: Serve in a traditional Indian serving dish.
Accompany with a side of cucumber salad or raita.
